intro: Heracleum sphondylium subsp. benearnense, commonly known as the lesser cow parsley, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Due to its attractive appearance and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens as a decorative plant.
